text: A hachimaki (鉢巻, "helmet scarf") is a headband with styles that came from Japan. They are usually made from red and white cloth. People wear them to show hard work, or to keep sweat from the eyes. == History == Nobody is sure how hachimaki started. Most people say that Samurai wore them under their helmets for comfort. Kamikaze pilots wore them before flying to their deaths. == Styles == Hachimaki are normally decorated with words, such as "Nippon Ichi" (日本一, "the best of Japan"), and with the rising sun between the kanji characters.
